unnormalised: ## Music Streaming: From Cassettes to Chaos (and Convenience!)
normalised: ## Music Streaming: From Cassettes to Chaos (and Convenience!)

unnormalised: Remember those days of meticulously curating cassette tapes? Spending hours dubbing songs off the radio, hoping you wouldn't catch the RJ's cheesy intro mid-verse? Ah, simpler times. Now, thanks to the magic of music streaming, my cassette collection is gathering dust in my parents' attic in Delhi.
normalised: Remember those days of meticulously curating cassette tapes? Spending hours dubbing songs off the radio, hoping you wouldn't catch the R J's cheesy intro mid-verse? Ah, simpler times. Now, thanks to the magic of music streaming, my cassette collection is gathering dust in my parents' attic in Delhi.

unnormalised: Seriously, who needs to rewind when you've got Spotify, Apple Music, Gaana, and JioSaavn fighting for your attention (and Rs. 99 a month)? I've gone from listening to the same 12 songs on repeat (courtesy of that "Now That's What I Call Music!" compilation my cousin Rajeev brought back from London in '98) to exploring genres I never knew existed. I even delved into some obscure Carnatic classical after watching a documentary about it on Doordarshan!

unnormalised: The convenience is just unbeatable. I can build playlists for literally every mood - a "Monsoon in Mumbai" mix (think slow, melancholic Bollywood tunes), a "Powering Through Work" playlist (lots of upbeat Punjabi pop, thanks Diljit Dosanjh!), or even a "Driving to Shimla" playlist featuring the best of Kishore Kumar.

unnormalised: Of course, there's the downside. The sheer volume of choice can be overwhelming. Remember being obsessed with *Kuch Kuch Hota Hai* soundtrack? Simpler times! Now, you have access to practically every song ever recorded. It's easy to get lost in the algorithmic rabbit hole and forget what you actually *like*. And the whole debate about artists getting fairly compensated is still raging, isn't it?

unnormalised: But overall, music streaming has revolutionized how we consume music. It's democratic, accessible, and constantly evolving. From catching the latest Bollywood hits while stuck in Bangalore traffic to discovering indie artists from Shillong, it's a musical journey available at our fingertips. So, plug in your headphones, find your vibe, and let the music play! Just try not to spend *too* much time browsing, okay? Your boss might not appreciate you air-drumming during that Zoom meeting. You've been warned!
